./.title: Introduction
./.body:
Introduction
What is telebroker_bot?
Telebroker_bot is a bot for Telegram that can transform text messages into commands on 1Broker.com website.

There are many cool features provided by @telebroker_bot:

Open and cancel orders
Close one or multiple Positions at once
Notification when a Position is Open
Notification when a Position is Closed
Easily Update Stop Loss or Take Profit value
Estimate Loss and Profit for positions
Customisable Trailing Stops
Also work on group chats allowing traders to share trades and ideas in real time
Manage positions really fast, at the speed of a message! from any device!!
Works on all modern Desktop and Mobile platforms

In a nutshell, the combination of 1Broker.com and @telebroker_bot gives you a modern, flexible and extremely powerful platform to manage your trades.
What is 1Broker?
If you are already familiar with 1Broker.com,
feel free to skip the following explanation. But for those of you who are new
to 1Broker.com, here's a quick intro:
1Broker.com is an online broker which allows you
to trade many Stocks, Forex, Indexes, Commodities and BTC/USD using your Bitcoins.
For example, imagine you have 1BTC and you believe Apple shares will
rise in the following days, you could then go to 1Broker.com
and "invest" 1BTC in Apple shares ( it's actually a CFD ),
if Apple rises 10% you'll then be able to close your position for a 10% profit ( minus brokerage fees )
Another example, 1Broker.com allows you to
leverage your trades, effectively multiplying the movement of the underlying
asset.
Imagine you buy 1BTC in Apple Shares with 2X Leverage, if Apple goes 10% up
you will effectively bank 20%, if apple share value drops by 5% then you will
loose 10%. Sounds complicated? I bet it doesn't!
What is Telegram?
Telegram is one of the greatest if not the greatest chat applcation
for those who don't know it, it's like Whatsapp on (a)steroids, it can do so
many funky things we don't even know where to start!
If you still don't have Telegram you can download it for free.

start/getting_Started.html.title: Getting Started
start/getting_Started.html.body:
Getting Started
After downloading and installing Telegram on your favourite(s)
devices there is only two very short steps before you can have endless amount
of typing fun !
Using the famous internet words: You don't know what happens next!

start/create_an_account.html.title: Create an Account
start/create_an_account.html.body:
Create an Account
In order to trade using telebroker_bot you will
 need  an account on 1Broker.com.
The registration is quite simple, free and only take a few seconds.
Once your account is created you will be able to navigate the website, browse
market information, see other traders, check your account balance and much
more.
As you can see the website allow you to pretty much do anything you need to
manage your positions by clicking around on the interface just as everyone
is used to.

start/connect_the_bot.html.title: Connect the bot
start/connect_the_bot.html.body:
Connect the bot
Now it's where the fun starts...
We will talk to our beloved bot so he will be able to assist us opening and
managing our trades and even notify us when important things happen.
Sounds cool? Then go ahead and start talking to the bot by clicking here
then launching Telegram.
Unfortunately the bot still doesn't have telepathic skills hence why we will
need to generate an API Token on 1Broker.com,
you can do it by going to the website and clicking on Access & API Management,
scrolling down and then clicking on "Generate API Token"
Once you have you generated your token you just have to send a message to the bot:
/token YOUR_API_TOKEN

Once you done you are ready to trade and manage your account any time
through Telegram messages!

commands/.title: Commands
commands/.body:
Commands
Commands are simply message that start with / when you send a message
starting by / the bot will receive the message and answer accordingly.
All the commands are being created organically based on user's needs, so
if you believe there is something missing Get in Touch!
You don't have to remember all the commands as you can easily see the list
of all available commands by typing /help
Ready to rock?

commands/long.html.title: /long
commands/long.html.body:
/long
This command allows you to open LONG orders on the market.
There are only two parameters needed

symbol - The Symbol of the market you will open the order.
margin - The amount of Bitcoin you will invest in this position.

/long eurusd 0.01

If you don't specify those you will receive help for the /long command.
Optional parameters

leverage

/long eurusd 0.01 50

This will create a LONG order with 50X leverage.

Since every market leverage have different allowed leverages you can also
specify it using MAX to use maximun allowed leverage or HALF for half of
the allowed leverage or even QUARTER ( you know for how much! ).
/long eurusd 0.01 max     # order will use 200X leverage
/long eurusd 0.01 half    # order will use 100X leverage
/long eurusd 0.01 quarter # order will use  50X leverage

Notes

You can mix and match Stop and Take Profit values

/long eurusd 0.01 50 -10% +200


For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/l command

commands/share-long.html.title: /share-long
commands/share-long.html.body:
/share-long
Same as /long but will share the position publicly
Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/share-l command

commands/short.html.title: /short
commands/short.html.body:
/short
This command allows you to open SHORT orders on the market.
There are only two parameters needed

symbol - The Symbol of the market you will open the order.
margin - The amount of Bitcoin you will invest in this position.

/short eurusd 0.01

If you don't specify those you will receive help for the /short command.
Optional parameters

leverage

/short eurusd 0.01 50

This will create a SHORT order with 50X leverage.

Since every market leverage have different allowed leverages you can also
specify it using MAX to use maximun allowed leverage or HALF for half of
the allowed leverage or even QUARTER ( you know for how much! ).
/short eurusd 0.01 max     # order will use 200X leverage
/short eurusd 0.01 half    # order will use 100X leverage
/short eurusd 0.01 quarter # order will use  50X leverage

Notes

You can mix and match Stop and Take Profit values
/short eurusd 0.01 50 -10% +200


For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/s command

commands/share-short.html.title: /share-short
commands/share-short.html.body:
/share-short
Same as /short but will share the position publicly
Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/share-s command

commands/stoploss.html.title: /stoploss
commands/stoploss.html.body:
/stoploss
This command allows you to update your Stop Loss for one or multiple positions.
When issuing the /stoploss command on a symbol, for instance eurusd all your
eurusd Positions will be updated together.
If you have more than one positions for a given symbol you can issue the command
on a specific position by using the Position #.
Using a fixed value
There are only two parameters needed

symbol    - The Symbol of the market you will update your Stop Loss
stop_loss - The amount new value of the Stop Loss

/stoploss eurusd 0.99

Will set the Stop to 0.99 USD
Using Points
/stoploss eurusd -100

Will set the Stop Loss to break even -100 Points
/stoploss eurusd +50

Will set the Stop Loss to break even +50 Points effectively guaranteing a
little profit on this Position
Using Percentage
/stoploss eurusd -10%

Will set the Stop Loss to -10% loss on the Position, it's important to note
that when using % your leverage will directly affect your stop.
For instance when using 100X Leverage your 10% Stop Loss will be much tighter
than when using 10X.
/stoploss eurusd +5%

Will set the Stop Loss to 5% profit on the Position, it's important to note
that when using % your leverage will directly affect your stop.
For instance when using 100X Leverage your 5% Stop Loss will be much tighter
than when using 10X.
Updating only a specific Order
Sometimes when managing multiple positions for the same symbol we might need
to update only one of the Positions, for that we will need the Order # which
can be found by typing:
/positions

Once we get the Order # we can then issue the command against that specific
Order
/stoploss 1131761 -13%

This will guarantee only Order #1131761 will be changed.
Specifying an Order # is only needed when multiple positions are open and
you want to edit only one.
Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/sl command

commands/takeprofit.html.title: /takeprofit
commands/takeprofit.html.body:
/takeprofit
This command allows you to update your Take Profit for one or multiple positions.
When issuing the /takeprofit command on a symbol, for instance eurusd all your
eurusd Positions will be updated together.
If you have more than one positions for a given symbol you can issue the command
on a specific position by using the Position #.
Using a fixed value
There are only two parameters needed

symbol      - The Symbol of the market you will update your Stop Loss
take_profit - The amount new value of the Stop Loss

/takeprofit eurusd 0.99

Will set the Stop to 0.99 USD
Using Points
/takeprofit eurusd -100

Will set the Stop Loss to break even -100 Points
/takeprofit eurusd +50 Points

Will set the Stop Loss to break even +50 Points effectively guaranteing a
little profit on this Position
Using Percentage
/takeprofit eurusd -10%

Will set the Stop Loss to -10% loss on the Position, it's important to note
that when using % your leverage will directly affect your stop.
For instance when using 100X Leverage your 10% Stop Loss will be much tighter
than when using 10X.
/takeprofit eurusd +5%

Will set the Stop Loss to 5% profit on the Position, it's important to note
that when using % your leverage will directly affect your stop.
For instance when using 100X Leverage your 5% Stop Loss will be much tighter
than when using 10X.
Updating only a specific Order
Sometimes when managing multiple positions for the same symbol we might need
to update only one of the Positions, for that we will need the Order # which
can be found by typing:
/positions

Once we get the Order # we can then issue the command against that specific
Order
/takeprofit 1131761 -13%

This will guarantee only Order #1131761 will be changed.
Specifying an Order # is only needed when multiple positions are open and
you want to edit only one.
Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/tp command

commands/positions.html.title: /positions
commands/positions.html.body:
/positions
Will list all your Open Positions.
/positions

Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/p command

commands/orders.html.title: /orders
commands/orders.html.body:
/orders
List all pending Orders.
/orders

Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/o command

commands/close.html.title: /close
commands/close.html.body:
/close
Close one or multiple positions in a market.
/close eurusd

Close all your EUR/USD Positions
/close 1131761

Close your Position #1131761
Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/c command

TODO

Add /close all to close all currently open positions

Have a suggestion? Create an issue !

commands/cancel.html.title: /cancel
commands/cancel.html.body:
/cancel
Will cancel open orders for a given market.
/long eurusd 0.01 # open an order on eurusd
/cancel eurusd    # will cancel the order

Goes without saying this only work while you Order isn't filled, once the order
is filled you made a mistake you will need to close the Position instead.

commands/default.html.title: /default
commands/default.html.body:
/default
Let's your specify default margin and leverage for /long and /short commands
so you can simply long or short without having to specify Margin and Leverage.
/default 0.01 max

Will set your default Margint to 0.01 and Leverage to the Maximum available
leverage for the market being traded so if you want to trade fast you don't
need to specify a value.
For instance:
/default 0.01 max
/long eurusd # will long eurusd with 0.01 BTC and 200X Leverage
/short snap  # will short Snapchat with 0.01 and 10X Leverage

commands/quote.html.title: /quote
commands/quote.html.body:
/quote
Simply display Bid, Ask and Spread for a given market.
/quote btcusd

Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/q command

commands/balance.html.title: /balance
commands/balance.html.body:
/balance
Retrieve the current balance and net worth of your Account.
/balance

Notes

For your convenience this command can also be triggered by issuing the
/b command

commands/token.html.title: /token
commands/token.html.body:
/token
Update your API Token
/token YOUR_API_TOKEN

In order to generate an Api Token please refer to thee
explanation on "Connect the bot"
Page

commands/donate.html.title: /donate
commands/donate.html.body:
/donate
Believe me or not this command didn't exist until a couple of users asked how
they could donate, needless to say it made us absolutely happy and guaranteed
a couple extra pizzas during our late hours.
Feel free to feel awesome and happy a starving Robot and a couple generous
nerds by Donating or Contributing
in any way!
All donations are and will be strictly used to improve the free bot and the
open source libraries unless strictly defined by donour - despite a few requests
we won't post nudes of our old school computer keyboards.
/donate

Will print the BTC donation address:
BTC: 1AsB6GtqUjHrLRXBzA19RMYyD7G9aVARbx

features/.title: Features
features/.body:
Features
We always try to come up with out of the box ideas, for instance we have been
providing Stop Loss and Take Profit to our users even before it was available
on the official 1Broker website and much more...
If you have any funky idea, please Get in Touch!
Go to the next page to learn about Notifications

features/notifications.html.title: Notifications
features/notifications.html.body:
Notifications
Notifactions happens when:

an Order is filled
@telebroker_bot will you the fill price

a Trade is copied
@telebroker_bot will tell you also your margin, leverage and send you a link
to see the trade on 1Broker's website

a Position is closed
@telebroker_bot will tell you also your final profit/ loss and profit/loss percentage


You will then receive push notifications
on your mobile or desktop, any platform you running Telegram!
( unless you have notifications muted )

features/group_chat.html.title: Group Chat
features/group_chat.html.body:
Group Chat
Not long ago we had a great idea, why not let the bot receive commands in a
group chat? Why not let users share their positions with their own group?
Basically this feature allows you to create a group chat with your friends
on Telegram and then add the bot as participant so everyone can manage
their own accounts and share their trades with their group friends.
In order to make your own group, simply create a group on Telegram and add
@telebroker_bot to it, you can also add your friends and your enemies !
This way you can trade and share your position in real time with your peers.
In case you create your own group, It's recommended to turn the group into a
supergroup, but that's up to you.
.... and that's not all!

features/trollbox.html.title: Trollbox!
features/trollbox.html.body:
Trollbox
Why not join The Official Unnoficial 1Broker Trollbox
and be ashamed together of our buy-high-sell-low moves?
As much as we would love the room to be funny and trolling, unfortunately
it's still not there, a lot of people take trading and being friendly seriously
over there, so make sure you come and help trolling some n00bs!

misc/Contact.html.title: Get in Touch
misc/Contact.html.body:
Get in Touch!
In case you need any support or have any questions, recommendations or suggestions
feel free to create an issue
on this repository.
There are a few ways of getting in touch in order to send a personal message
feel free to send me throug reddit
or ask anybody at the Trollbox or even open a thread
on 1Broker's reddit

misc/FAQ.html.title: FAQ
misc/FAQ.html.body:
FAQ

How secure is my 1Broker.com account when
using @telebroker_bot ?

This is a very common question and unfortunately the answer isn't as simple
as the question, but in short: Your balance is safe.
When creating an API Token it will only allow applications to open trades,
and see your account information, withdrawals aren't allowed. So in the worst
case if someone still your laptop and get your API Token the thief wouldn't
be able to take your money away from you.
Also if something scary like that happens you can easily revoke the key on the
Access & API Management page
of the website, this would avoid any more operations in your account using the
API.

Will the bot support other brokers and exchanges ?

As you can imagine supporting properly and smartly one exchange is already
hard enough, it's not easy to please everyone while creating a feature rich
application.
Since this application is being developed without any investors it's difficult
to rapidly scale to other exchanges quickly, if you have something in mind pleae
Get in Touch!

misc/Glossary.html.title: Glossary
misc/Glossary.html.body:
Glossary
Most of those definitions if not all were kindly borrowed from investopedia.com

CFD more info

The difference between where a trade is entered and exited is the contract for difference (CFD). A CFD is a tradable instrument that mirrors the movements of the asset underlying it. It allows for profits or losses to be realized when the underlying asset moves in relation to the position taken, but the actual underlying asset is never owned. Essentially, it is a contract between the client and the broker. Trading CFDs has several major advantages, and these have increased the popularity of the instruments over the last several years.

Leverage more info

Leverage is the use of various financial instruments or borrowed capital, such as margin, to increase the potential return of an investment.

Long more info

A long (or long position) is the buying of a security such as a stock, commodity or currency with the expectation the asset will rise in value. In the context of options, it is the buying of an options contract. A long position is the opposite of a short (or short position).

Short more info

A short, or short position, is a directional trading or investment strategy where the investor sells shares of borrowed stock in the open market. The expectation of the investor is that the price of the stock will decrease over time, at which point the he will purchase the shares in the open market and return the shares to the broker which he borrowed them from.

misc/Contribute.html.title: Contribute
misc/Contribute.html.body:
Contribute
Thanks for reaching out this section!
Helping with this documentation
If you find any errors or can somehow help improving this documentation, please
go ahead and click "EDIT THIS PAGE" !
Node.js Library
1broker-client is a node.js library available on github, checkout our repository
You can contribute by adding more features to it, or just by help house
keeping by creating issues
and reviewing code/documentation.
Or getting directly into ninja work writing some more tests!
Donate
This bot was initially created to help a small group of friends to trade and
manage our orders anytime anywhere, hence why we give so much love to it, we
use it constantly, every day and we are always thinking how to improve it to
help us making better trades.
Needless to say we are investing a lot of time and care into this, the bot doesn't even sleep
 24 hours!
All donations will be use exclusively towards improving the bot and open source
goods as mucha s we can for as long as we possibly can image!
You can send some BTC our way
a few happy users already donated and shown their love!
BTC: 1AsB6GtqUjHrLRXBzA19RMYyD7G9aVARbx

Thanks a lot and dont hesitate Getting in touch!
